article-meta.issue-title: Special Issue: Teaching People About Groups

body.p: Submission Deadline: Submissions must be received by Friday, January 31, 2014 (10 p.m. EST).

The Ninth Annual INGRoup Conference will be held so scholars across disciplines can come together, share information, and learn from one another. The conference program will include paper, poster, symposia, and panel sessions, a keynote address, and a business meeting open to all members so the future of INGRoup can be collectively planned and shaped.

Submissions: An online system (accessible via www.ingroup.net) will be made available from late-November, 2013, to January 31, 2014. Regardless of type, all submissions must be accompanied by a 50-word abstract for inclusion in the conference program. Provide full name, position, institution, discipline, and email for all submitters. Submissions that include participants from a variety of disciplinary traditions are highly encouraged. Scholars can be the presenting author on no more than three submissions. Late submissions will not be accepted. We accept papers, extended abstracts, posters, symposium, and panels for consideration.
The full call for papers and more information about submissions and the conference can be found at www.ingroup.net
For more information, see the INGRoup website (www.ingroup.net) or contact:

list-item.p: Joann Keyton (Conference Coordinator), North Carolina State University (jkeyton@ncsu.edu)

body.p: Conference Location: Renaissance Hotel, Raleigh, NC, USA; room block reserved for conference.
